@francispouliot_ @cryptomanran Bare multisig (OP_CHECKMULTISIG) has existed from the beginning, as were OP_IF, OP_AND and a whole host of other "smart contract" features. This myth that Ethereum somehow created smart contracts is a lie pure and simple.

@jimmysong @_Kevin_Pham @cryptomanran Bitcoin could have been given a modern Turing complete scripting language. The technology for this has been pretty mature for decades.  Limiting the script was a deliberate decision in the design of Bitcoin. Ethereum reintroduced the issues that had been intentionally avoided.

@cryptomanran This is a grossly inept analogy. First, Ethereum's smart contract usage is extremely limited. Vast majority of the data on their network is ERC20 and ERC721 tokens, neither of which require Turing completeness.

@jimmysong @cryptomanran I don’t understand why there’s this obsession with smart contracts on the protocol level of bitcoin. If you have an opportunity to build compartmentalized layers on a chain, it disables attack vectors we see with ethereum and EOS. Smart scaling is better than fast scaling.
